byline.contributor: Jennifer Medina reported from Los Angeles, and Jess Bidgood from Boston. Laurie Goodstein and Julia Preston contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA and JESS BIDGOOD

abstract: Mayors of New York, Los Angeles and other so-called sanctuary cities risk losing millions in federal funds by refusing to cooperate locally with Pres-elect Donald J Trump's proposal to deport millions of illegal immigrants; supporters of crackdown on undocumented immigrants expect Trump to make all-out effort to discourage such interference with federal agencies by local law enforcement officials.
lead_paragraph: Officials in what are known as sanctuary cities say they will act as a bulwark against mass deportations, even at the risk of losing federal money for local services.
snippet: Officials in what are known as sanctuary cities say they will act as a bulwark against mass deportations, even at the risk of losing federal money for local services....

headline.main: Cities Vow to Fight Trump on Immigration, Even if They Lose Millions
headline.print_headline: Cities Vow to Fight Trump on Immigration, Even at a Steep Cost
